p: Few reports exist on the chemistry of this species. These include the identification of phenolics and flavonoids from the EtOAc, MeOH and BuOH/water extracts of a specimen collected in Crete ( Figure 3) [ 36]. While compound 12 was isolated, compounds 9â€“11 were tentatively identified by LC-DAD-MS. The extracts exhibited high levels of anti-oxidant activity and the authors suggest that these invasive plants may serve as an inexpensive and renewable source of bioactive compounds [ 36].
